Articles.Content: What's your favorite hexadecimal color mines #bada55

The best color for our robot's LEDs is #00FFFF. Though #FFFF00 is nice too.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-20T21:52:10Z" title="02/20/2015 09:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 20, 2015</time> by Starwhip**
I like #C0FFEE

> 
> I like #C0FFEE

I am disappointed that turned out to be a **light teal** instead of a dark brown.
I usually go with **#6699CC** when I have to choose a color for a chatbox or something, just because I like it and it's HTML-friendly and easy to remember.

> 
> I am disappointed that turned out to be a **light teal** instead of a dark brown.

dark brown is ~0xC0FFEE

> 
> dark brown is ~0xC0FFEE

**Looks like dark blue.**

> 
> **Looks like dark blue.**

Not 0xC0FFEE, ~0xC0FFEE!

I can't find any piece of software that will accept the ~ character. Trying it in the forums just breaks the color tag (for example). None of my graphic editing programs will accept it either. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I am sure many of us have heard of the color of the Universe: FFF8E7.

> 
> I can't find any piece of software that will accept the ~ character. Trying it in the forums just breaks the color tag (for example). None of my graphic editing programs will accept it either. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Sorry. I guess it was a bit too cryptic... 

"~" is a bit-wise not in the c programming language. Bit-wise not of 0xC0FFEE is 0x3F0011.

> 
> Sorry. I guess it was a bit too cryptic... 
> "~" is a bit-wise not in the c programming language. Bit-wise not of 0xC0FFEE is 0x3F0011.

Ah, gotcha. Been a while since I did any programming in C, and I wasn't really a fan. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

n a different, but similar note: as a kerbal, my skin colour would be #5MT455 (Oops, I used HTML)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-21T10:13:29Z" title="02/21/2015 10:13  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 21, 2015</time> by NeatCrown**
Kerbals skin is bada55

FAFAFA Is my favorite color to type with here. Why? Because of this

The best part is that only a few of you will actually see this

> 
> FAFAFA Is my favorite color to type with here. Why?

I'm not sure. What's so special about it? Is this it? XD Yeah, it's the InvisiText Color

> 
> I'm not sure. What's so special about it?

Its just a neat color.

Hey, we could start a secret organization dedicated to invisible messages or something!

> 
> Kerbals skin is bada55

Nein. While it sounds badass in every sense, this rumor has been debunked on the wiki.

Oh yeah, and if I'm ninja'd because wiki, I still won't care.

> 
> Its just a neat color.

To each their own. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

You wouldn't believe the things people write in this color sometimes... :]

I also like #ABCDEF

**#DCF3FF** is one of my favorites. 

I don't know if this is weird, but I wouldn't mind having skin that color. Especially if it sort of fluoresced in sunlight. hmmmm.

Other than that, I'm rather fond of **#8000FF** and other shades of blue-violet. Greens such as **#60D731** are neat too, as is **#9CB5C1**.

**#bada55** 

Always, forever. No color is better.

(except mabye **#000066, AKA Zokesian Blue)**
I also like ee6666

> 
> I also like ee6666

Forgot the [noparse]**"**<color here=""></color>**"**] operators...
